cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the central Gulf, then turning north toward the Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Cameron, LA to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cameron, LA eastward to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast TX to southwestern LA, then northward through southern MS/AL and the FL Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Chance (20%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; most sustained winds expected below 34 kt
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible (1–2 ft) mainly east of the port toward High Island
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches in bands; localized ponding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado threat well east of Galveston; operational impacts mainly from periodic heavy rain and elevated seas
